answers.answer: Your HBsAg is < 1000 iu/ml and your hbvdna is < 20 iu/ml. Current research literature indicates:1. You are likely to be a good candidate for stopping medication. Please note, stopping rules for taking antivirals are not well defined, but seems to require a low HBsAg2. You are likely to be a good candidate for adding PegINFN to your treatment in order to clear HBsAg.All of these are experimental and no yet in standard guidelines. I am sure stef2012 will inform you further, especially about Alinia.I don't know how diabetes will affect the outcome. There is some research coming out that indicates Metformin (Diabex) may protect against liver cancer.Just my opinion.
Shouldn't the HBV DNA be Undetected before he can proceed with Interferon?

The reasoning works like this:The immune system is exhausted from constantly fighting the virus. A period of undetectable hbvdna brings peace and seems to allow parts of the immune system to recover and refresh.. At this time, if we then add Interferon, which stimulates the immune system,  this together with a refreshed immune system, may be able to overcome the virus. Furthermore, if serum HBsAg level is low, its inhibition of the immune system will be lessened, making it even easier for the immune system to clear and control the virus.Just my over simplified views of things.

Dear aberdeen577,I   have  seen  ur  post in this forum. My history of the case is as follows:I  am  61 years now.  Firstly I came to know  hepb positive in Feb2011.  As per my doctor’s prescription,  I  have  been  taking  baraclude  0.5mg  since then  ie. for the past two and half years. With this , I have added on Zincovit, a multi vitamin food supplement  and  pantocid 40mg. No other medicine was taken so far. My latest test reports are as detailed below.HbsAg-545.1 iu/ml as on 19.10.13(738 iu/ml as on 11.03.13; 745 iu/ml as on 27.10.2012)Hbeag-negativeAnti-hbsag-0.2 miu/mlHbvdna- <20 IU/ml by COBAS TAQMAN methodALT-48 U/L(Cut off value 30-65)AST-34 U/L(Cut off value 15-37)Liver function test-NormalUltrasound scan: normalOther tests such as Billurubin, ProteinTotal-Serum/Plasma, Albumin-Serum, Globulin-Serum, GGTP, ALP, AFP,Urea, Creatinine are normal. Also prothrombin time,bleeding time, clotting time are also normal. I am having diabetes which is also under control.Lastly  I  met my dr on 19.10.2013 regarding  the  peg-inf  injection  to be added on. But he didn't recommend for peg ifn saying that my age is 61yo and no ifn is necy for und dna. I have been taking  baraclude 0.5mg monotherapy.  At this stage I decided to follow ur medication and diet and other habits after consulting my doctor. So kindly share ur history since from the first detection of the case mentioning the baselines before medication.Your reply will help me to proceed further.Thanking u.

Dear Stef2011,First of aIl I appreciate ur tremendous service in this forum. Daily I see ur replies. All are encouraging to the members.   Now come to my case. U have replied me as follows.“ HBsag-545.1 iu/mlwith this hbsag level you can clear hbsag by adding peginterferon to entecavir in 24 to 48 weeks, check otan post and her clearance by peginterferon in less than 24weeks of treatment post in this forum”.Once again I furnish my history of the case as follows:I  am  61 years now.  Firstly I came to know  hepb positive in Feb2011.  As per my doctor’s prescription,  I  have  been  taking  baraclude  0.5mg for the past two years 10 months. With this , I have added on Zincovit, a multi vitamin food supplement  which includes VitaminD3- 400iu, Zinc- 22mg, Selenium-50mg VitaminA-5000iu,VitaminC-75mg.and  pantocid 40mg. No other medicine was taken so far. My latest test reports are as detailed below.HbsAg-545.1 iu/ml as on 19.10.13(738 iu/ml as on 11.03.13; 745 iu/ml as on 27.10.2012)Hbeag-negativeAnti-hbsag-0.2 miu/mlHbvdna- <20 IU/ml by COBAS TAQMAN methodALT-48 U/L(Cut off value 30-65)AST-34 U/L(Cut off value 15-37)Liver function test-NormalUltrasound scan: normalBeing an Indian, my genotype may be probably D.Other tests such as Billurubin, ProteinTotal-Serum/Plasma, Albumin-Serum, Globulin-Serum, GGTP, ALP, AFP,Urea, Creatinine are normal. Also prothrombin time,bleeding time, clotting time are also normal. I am having diabetes which is also under control. Lastly  I  met my dr on 19.10.2013 regarding  the  peg-inf  injection  to be added on. But he didn't recommend for peg ifn saying that my age is 61yo and no ifn is necy for und dna. I have been taking  baraclude 0.5mg monotherapy. Now I am adding immune boosting things like Garlic, Citrus, Oranges and Lemons, Carrots, and Papayas, Flaxseeds, Red Bell Peppers, Broccoli, Ginger, Kale(Spinach), Green Leafy Vegetables, Yogurt, Turmeric,  Green Tea. Also I am having sunexposure and exercise at least one hour daily.  Regularly, I am browsing this forum as if anything new for the cure.  At this stage I decided to follow ur valuable guidelines as u are having experience with the best liver specialists and researchers. Your reply will help me to proceed further.Thanking u.
